name: ZipBlobs
description: Returns a list of blobs as a zip file.
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

C.name: BlobID
C.description:
Can be used for standard blobs - for secure blobs, use `BlobUrl` instead.

This is the ID of a `Blob`

C.name: BlobUrl
C.description: Can be used for both standard- and secured blobs - must match environment assets URL.

C.name: Path
C.description: Path of the file in the resulting zip, including filename - when not set, files are set to root using their original blob name or else a random UUID.

B.name: Blobs
B.description: List of blobs to be included in the zip file.

B.name: ZipName
B.description: Name of the generated zip file, will default to 'download.zip' if not specified.

E.name: Code
E.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

E.name: Message
E.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

E.name: RequestID
E.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

E.name: Type
E.description: A short description of the error type.

F.name: ExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

F.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
F.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

F.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
